description: Comparative theology is the study and interpretation of one religion in conversation
with the texts, symbols, and practices of other religious traditions.  It aims to
discover new theological insights from another or from one's own tradition.  This
course explores the nature of comparative theology as a method of doing
theology.  Students read and assess seminal works of comparative theology from
the traditions of Buddhism, Christianity, Hinduism, and Islam.  Offered annually.  Prerequisite:
